abstract: The chief executive of Lockheed Martin, the builder of the fighter jet, said under Senate pressure that some of the program’s costs could be lowered.
snippet: The chief executive of Lockheed Martin, the builder of the fighter jet, said under Senate pressure that some of the program’s costs could be lowered.
lead_paragraph: CRYSTAL CITY, Va. — A new estimate that 2,400 F-35 fighter jets could cost $1 trillion to operate over 50 years has created more pressure to cut costs in the Pentagon’s largest program.

headline.main: Panel Told of Plan to Reduce F-35 Costs
headline.print_headline: Panel Told of Plan to Reduce F-35 Costs
